intro: Clidemia fraterna, commonly known as false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia fraterna is also known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain regions.
